title: Count Binary Substrings
problemStatement:
You’re given a binary string. Your task is to count the number of substrings that:
- Have equal number of 0s and 1s, and
- All the 0s and all the 1s must be grouped together.

Note: Repeated substrings are counted each time they occur.

examples.explanation:
Valid substrings are: 0011, 01, 1100, 10, 0011, 01.
We care about both count and grouping.

approach:
Naive Approach
1. Check all substrings and count 0s and 1s while verifying if 0s and 1s are grouped together.
2. This results in O(n²) time complexity and is inefficient for large inputs.

3. Optimized Approach
Instead of generating all substrings, we count consecutive 0s and 1s in groups.
1. Walk through the string character by character.
2. Count how many times the same character repeats in a row.
3. Store each group count in an array.
4. For every pair of adjacent groups, take the minimum of the two.
5. Add all such minimums to get the final result.
This reduces the time complexity to O(n) and uses O(n) space.
timeComplexity: O(n) – One pass to count group sizes, one pass to compute result
spaceComplexity: O(n) – For storing the group sizes in an array
